communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request an electronic copy of all FBI files on Morgan Spurlock, the documentary filmmaker most famous for the film "Supersize Me." He died in May 2024. Here is his obituary: https://apnews.com/article/morgan-spurlock-dies-246036b526cdeaf55f7d1335461775a5

I request that your agency conduct a full CRS search, as well as a cross reference search, to retrieve records related to this prominent American.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: R131731-052324
communications.communication:
Dear Daniel Boguslaw: 
 
Thank you for your interest in the public records of the Austin Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 5/23/2024 and given the reference number R131731-052324 for tracking purposes. 
Please be advised that the Austin Police Department’s Central Records Division receives over 2500 requests for information a month. These requests are processed in the order received, and we strive to respond to each request promptly, as required by law. 
Please know that, as a result of the large volume of requests received, the anticipated timeframe for responding to your request may take 10 business days if it is simply an offense report you're requesting.  If you are requesting body cam, dash cam, or other related records your request could take up to 30 days. 
You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records requested. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Austin Public Records Center. 
Austin Police Department

communications.subject: Mayor's Office - Return to Office Communications 2023 through May 21st 2024
communications.communication:
THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA      Re: Mayor's Office - Return to Office Communications 2023 through May 21st 2024    Your receipt number is: 28050  Dear 164074-30279347@requests. muckrock. com, 
   
 Thank you for your correspondence.  This is an automatic email confirming that your correspondence has been entered into our case management system for processing and response. If you have an additional request you wish to file, or if you wish to make a change to a pending request, please email it directly to righttoknowlaw@.phila.gov.     Did you know that the City already releases a lot of information and open data online?  You might be able to find the answer to your inquiry right now!   
   
 
Here are some common types of requests we receive and where to find this information online right now:  
 
 Search for a property's L&I related permits, licenses, violations, and appeals with the L&I property history tool.  
 
 Search for a property's Real Estate Tax Balance with the Revenue Department's tax real estate lookup tool.  
 
 Find all of the City of Philadelphia's open data sets, including City employee salary data, on Open Data Philly, the Philadelphia region's open data portal.  
 
 Search information about professional service contracts online at eContract Philly.  
 
 Search information about procurement contracts online with PHL Contracts.  
 
 Search City legislation and related hearings online with Legistar.  
 
 Obtain financial disclosure forms from the Department of Records.  
 
 
   If you seek a police incident report, you can obtain the proper form from the Department of Records.  Please note that police incident reports cost $25.      If you seek audio, visual, or bodycam records from the Philadelphia Police Department, you will need to make a request following the instructions in 42 Pa.C.S.A. Sec. 67A03 at https://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=42&div=0&chpt=67A. Such requests must be made in-person or via 
certified mail following the instructions in 42 Pa.C.S.A. §  67A(3) (aka
 Act 22). Such requests are not processed under the RTKL. See 42 Pa.C.S.A. § 67A(2)(a); 65 P.S. §§ 67.305, 67.3101.1. You may use this form to make a request under Act 22. Requests under Act 22  should be addressed to: Lieutenant Barry Jacobs, Philadelphia Police Department, Open Records/Right to Know Section, Philadelphia Public Services Building, 400 N. Broad St., 4W-72, Philadelphia, PA 19130. Such requests are not processed under the Right-to-Know Law.       Use the forms on this page to request copies of various public safety from the Department of Records, such as:   
 Traffic Accident Reports (aka "crash report" - also available through https://public-safety-reports.phila.gov/)  A records check or letter of good conduct from the Philadelphia Police Department  Fire Reports  Emergency Medical Services Reports       The City of Philadelphia does not process Right-to-Know requests for the organizations listed below.  If you want to submit a request to one of these entities, please click the links below to be directed to their Open Records Policies:

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), I am requesting access to records maintained by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) related to psychiatric consultation guidance for interprofessional services. Specifically, I am seeking documents, guidelines, memos, correspondence, or any other materials that provide guidance or instructions on the following topics:

Psychiatric Consultation for Interprofessional Services: Any guidance related to the provision of psychiatric consultation services between healthcare professionals, including but not limited to consultations from psychiatrists to other healthcare providers and vice versa.

Billing and Reimbursement: Documentation detailing the billing procedures, codes, and reimbursement policies for interprofessional psychiatric consultation services under Medicare and Medicaid.

Training and Implementation: Materials used for training healthcare providers on the appropriate procedures and practices for conducting interprofessional psychiatric consultations.

Policy Development and Updates: Any records of policy development, revisions, or updates pertaining to psychiatric consultation services for interprofessional practice, including internal memos, drafts, and final versions of such policies.

Communication and Correspondence: Internal and external communications, including emails, letters, and meeting minutes, discussing the implementation, challenges, or evaluations of interprofessional psychiatric consultation services.

I request that any fees associated with this request be waived, as the information is sought for educational purposes and not for commercial use. If there are any questions or if you need additional information to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Trevor Davis

communications.communication:

The NDC Directory does not include products which are no longer being marketed.

communications.communication:
This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email, on May 20, 2024. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, May 21, 2024.

Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before June 12, 2024.

Your request is being handled by Karl Newman. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Karl Newman at newmank@detroitmi.gov<mailto:newmank@detroitmi.gov>to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.



Jack Dietrich, Supervising Assistant Corporation Counsel City of Detroit Law Department

313-237-5030

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ivan Frederick Boesky (March 6, 1937 — May 20, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former financier and convicted insider trader Ivan Frederick Boesky (March 6, 1937 — May 20, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/05/20/business/ivan-f-boesky-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an associate editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: FBI File for Walter Lee Parman (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI File for Walter Lee Parman (Central Intelligence Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. 552), I am requesting access to and copies of all records related to Walter Lee Parman, also known under multiple aliases including George D. Farr, Lopez Arrigo, Frederic William Aykens, James Darnell, James Gary, James Gay, Robert Gordan, Walter Lee-Lyte Parman, Robert Rodriguez, and Edgar K. Sanders.

Walter Lee Parman was involved in various criminal activities, was on the FBI's Most Wanted List, and was convicted for the murder of Shirley Ann Cary in 1965. He also escaped from prison and was recaptured in 1984 under the alias Mike Noble. I am particularly interested in any recorded testimony given under the influence of sodium pentathol during his trial.

Please include all relevant files, correspondence, arrest records, and any other materials related to these matters. If some portions of these documents are exempt from release, please provide me with the non-exempt portions.

If there are any fees for searching or copying the records, please inform me of the cost before processing my request. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public's understanding of the case.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, please justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the act. I expect the release of all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material. I reserve the right to appeal any decision to withhold information or deny a waiver of fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nathan Isaac

title: Investigation of the Murder of Shirley Ann Cary (Metropolitan Police Department)

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Investigation of the Murder of Shirley Ann Cary (Metropolitan Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All case files and investigation files related to the murder investigation of Shirley Ann Cary, a State Department employee, who was murdered on January 9, 1965, in Washington, D.C. by Walter Lee Parman.
All correspondence regarding the case, including but not limited to letters, emails, memos, and other forms of communication between law enforcement agencies and other relevant parties.
All recordings associated with the case, including audio, video, and any other recorded material.

To assist with locating the requested records, the details of the case are as follows:

Victim: Shirley Ann Cary
Date of Incident: January 9, 1965
Location: Washington, D.C.
Perpetrator: Walter Lee Parman

If there are any fees for searching or copying the records, please inform me of the cost before processing my request. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public's understanding of the case.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, please justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the act. I expect the release of all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material. I reserve the right to appeal any decision to withhold information or deny a waiver of fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nathan Isaac

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Alexandra Collins- Granite City, Illinois
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern:

I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against the actions of individuals involved in the watchlist operation, which I believe have resulted in the commission of unlawful acts. It has come to my attention that certain individuals associated with the watchlist operation are engaging in tactics such as man-in-the-middle cyber attacks to obstruct, manipulate, and misrepresent communications, particularly when submitting online reports to the Department of Homeland Security Office of Inspector General, Attorneys, and other Government entities. For the sake of transparency and accountability, I am submitting this complaint through Muck Rock to ensure that the public is informed of my concerns and to facilitate the proper filing and tracking of this complaint.

My involvement in this matter stems from being unjustly placed on a watchlist subsequent to my disclosure of misconduct within the Radiology Department at Mercy Hospital in Creve Coeur, Missouri. I strongly believe that I obtain proof and may have witnesses that substantiates my claim.

I am writing to you with regard to my 6 year wrongful inclusion in a watchlist under the jurisdiction of the Granite City Police Department and the Saint Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group (STLFC). I have reason to believe that I have been subjected to various forms of abuse, harassment, and exploitation as a result of this inclusion. This grievance pertains specifically to the actions of individuals within the Saint Louis Fusion Center, as well as its collaborative partners in State, Local, Tribal, Territorial Law Enforcement (F/SLTT), Air National Guard, and private sector partners.

It has come to my attention that the Saint Louis Fusion Center and affiliates, in conjunction with programs established by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), such as the St. Louis Urban Area Security Initiative (UASI), has engaged in practices that have violated established security protocols, Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), and federal laws, notably the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act, 18 USC SEC 1030.

Additionally, I have been subjected to unfair treatment that includes one or more persons acting under color of law willfully depriving and conspiring to deprive me of my rights protected by the constitution. This misconduct goes beyond mere allegations of negligence commonly associated with law enforcement collaborations with Fusion Centers.
I have reason to believe that certain individuals associated with the operation have inappropriately disseminated my personal information for fraudulent purposes, potentially for personal gain, thereby compromising my privacy and potentially exposing me to unwarranted harm. These actions have not only caused me distress but have also raised serious concerns regarding the integrity and legality of the operations carried out by the Saint Louis Fusion Center and its affiliates. Moreover, I am deeply troubled by the revelation that there are instances of misuse of telecommunications satellites and systems, which may pose a threat to security and integrity. I have reason to believe that these individuals have been using intelligence tactics to instill fear and create a sense of insecurity.

During the course of this operation, I have experienced instances of cruel and unusual punishment, including sexual misconduct, harassment, bodily injuries, discrimination, exploitation, mail tampering, and medical violations due to the arbitrary exercise of power. Furthermore, I have encountered Intelligence operators who have been involved in concealing, altering, and destroying evidence relevant to the situation. Additionally, these operators have intercepted telephone lines in an attempt to hinder me from reporting the illicit activities to government authorities and attorneys.

As a law-abiding citizen, I expect that my rights and privacy are protected by those tasked with upholding the law. It is disheartening to discover that I have become a victim of misconduct and negligence within a system that is meant to safeguard the well-being of its citizens.

I urge your office to conduct a thorough investigation into these allegations and take the necessary steps to rectify any injustices that have been inflicted upon me.

Your expertise and oversight in this matter are crucial to ensuring the integrity and effectiveness of our national security systems. Your prompt attention to this request is greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your dedicated service and commitment to upholding the highest standards of accountability and security in our government operations.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Collins

Alexandra Collins
Granite City, Illinois 62040-2013

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Alexandra Collins- Granite City, Illinois
communications.communication:
Good Morning Ms. Collins,

The ODNI does not conduct investigations.   We recommend you submit your complaint to your local for federal law enforcement.

The ODNI’s mission, since April 2005, has been to serve as the head of the Intelligence Community (IC), lead intelligence integration, and forge an IC that delivers the most insightful intelligence possible.  The DNI also acts as the principal advisor to the President; the National Security Council, and the Homeland Security Council for intelligence matters related to national security; and oversees and directs the implementation of the National Intelligence Program.

Thank you,
DNI-FOIA

During the course of this operation, I have experienced instances of cruel and unusual punishment, including sexual misconduct, harassment, bodily injuries, discrimination, exploitation, mail tampering, and medical violations due to the arbitrary exercise of power. Furthermore, I have encountered Intelligence operators who have been involved in concealing, altering, and destroying evidence relevant to the situation. Additionally, these operators have intercepted telephone lines in an attempt to hinder me from reporting the illicit activities to government authorities and attorneys.

As a law-abiding citizen, I expect that my rights and privacy are protected by those tasked with upholding the law. It is disheartening to discover that I have become a victim of misconduct and negligence within a system that is meant to safeguard the well-being of its citizens.

I urge your office to conduct a thorough investigation into these allegations and take the necessary steps to rectify any injustices that have been inflicted upon me.

Your expertise and oversight in this matter are crucial to ensuring the integrity and effectiveness of our national security systems. Your prompt attention to this request is greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your dedicated service and commitment to upholding the highest standards of accountability and security in our government operations.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Collins

Alexandra Collins
Granite City, Illinois 62040-2013

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Collins

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RE: FOIL REQUEST | TOHAS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Animal Intake and Disposition (2023-24)

    ○ Monthly totals of Cats and Dogs received by TOHAS for each month of the calendar year 2023-24.

    ○ Disposition of each animal, categorized as follows:

        • Returned to owner
        • Adopted
        • Died (natural causes)
        • Euthanized
        • Transferred out (including the name and contact information of the receiving organization)

2. Animal Care Policies and Procedures

    ○ All Standard Operating Procedures ("SOPs") in effect at any time during 2023-24 for the care and treatment of shelter animals, covering:

        • Feeding and water provision
        • Medical and behavioral care
        • Socialization and enrichment
        • Euthanasia policies and protocols
        • Staff training and qualification requirements

3. Placement Partner Organizations (PPO) Policies and Procedures

    ○ All SOPs in effect at any time during 2023-24 regarding collaborations with PPOs, including but not limited to:

        • Criteria for selecting PPOs
        • Processes for facilitating animal transfers
        • Follow-up or tracking procedures for animals placed with PPOs

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Colon

title: Air Permits for Electricity Genberators in Houston, Texas

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Air Permits for Electricity Genberators in Houston, Texas
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sirs:
This letter constitutes a request under the Texas Public Information Act, on behalf of
Targeted Justice Inc.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be
provided to Targeted Justice:

1. Records and documents pertaining to the permits issued under the Clean Air Act for all portable and emergency generators located in or servicing cell towers in the Houston, Texas area as of May 17, 2024. The information to be provided shall include at a minimum the following:

a - Permit Holder Name
b - Exact location (address) of generator
c - Generator make, year and capacity
d - First permit date issuance 
e- Current permit date issuance and expiration.
f - Identity of carrier or customer to be serviced by generator.

The term “document” is to be liberally construed to include any file, paper, microfilm, digital archive, or  any other format where the information sought may be stored. As you know, the Public Information Act requires agencies to release information unless it is specifically exempt from disclosure, and also requires agencies to release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of documents, i.e., to redact exempt portions of documents and release the rest.  Targeted Justice's status as a news organization that provides information of public interest to its members warrants the expedited processing of this Request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed by an organization primarily engaged in disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. 

Request for expedited processing

Targeted Justice currently has over 15,000 subscribers and over 115,000 thousands views a month in its
Substack newsletter. Thus, it is considered a news media organization  Targeted Justice also requests the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that the records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence”. 

Request for Fee Waiver

Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that it has no commercial interest other than informing the public about matters of public concern. 

Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as Targeted Justice will report the results of this endeavor on the grounds that Targeted Justice qualifies as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use.

For any document you fail to produce, Targeted Justice requests that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.

If you need to discuss this request, the undersigned can be reached at 832-247-3046 or 281-772-7668. Thank you for your consideration of my request.

Sincerely,

Ana L. Toledo for Targeted Justice, Inc.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Targeted Justice

communications.subject: TCEQ Open Records Request - PIR 24-94162
communications.communication:
Dear Customer, 

Thank you for your Public Information Request received under the Texas Public Information Act. 

Your request has been assigned: PIR 24-94162. 
Please refer to this number in any communications regarding your request. 

You will receive a response from the Agency within ten (10) business days. 

TCEQ charges for the costs of responding to Public Information Requests in accordance with state statute. If the estimated cost to fulfill your request: 
  * is $40 or less, we will fulfill your request and provide you with an invoice. If requested, as a courtesy we will provide an estimate before we fulfill your request. 
  * exceeds $40, before we fulfill your request, we will provide you with an estimate, which you must accept in writing. 
  * exceeds $100, before we initiate fulfillment of your request you must pay a 50% deposit. 
Thank you, 
The Open Records Team

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

* Adam Loredo, teacher at Hawthorne Scholastic, previously at Ogden International
* Rashad Talley, interim principal at Wendell Phillips
* Joshua Vander Jagt, ex-Principal at Ogden, Assistant Principal at Hyde Park Academy
* Jezail Jackson, teacher at Wendell Phillips, previously at Ogden International
* Holly Caldwell, Assistant Principal at Wendell Phillips 

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Thank you for your interest in Chicago Public Schools. Your FOIA request has been submitted. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: N015306-051924 
You have requested the following records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. A log of all emails to/from the CPS Ethics Officer, from May 1, 2024 - May 15, 2024. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

2. Calendars for Jennifer Chan, CPS Ethics Officer, from January 1, 2024 - the date this FOIA is processed.

3. Membership list of those on the CPS Ethics Committee as of the date this FOIA is processed.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcps-ethics-officer-164009%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ9RYhgoBNi1Pb8mf_KKixYw%3A1s8tqY%3AL6PpA3-0we57b5v0csbLkqAAJnN0iqrlGYJpsa0z3zE 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15306

title: CPS: Akerman, Ancel, Engler Bills, 2023 - Current

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Akerman, Ancel, Engler Bills, 2023 - Current
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2023 through current:

1) Copies of all invoices from the Akerman LLP;
2) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Akerman LLP. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.
3) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Akerman LLP, including any modifications or changes.

4) Copies of all invoices from the Ancel Glick PC;
5) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Ancel Glick PC. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.
6) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Ancel Glick PC, including any modifications or changes.

7) Copies of all invoices from the Engler Callaway Baasten & Sraga LLC;
8) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Engler Callaway Baasten & Sraga LLCC. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.
9) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Engler Callaway Baasten & Sraga LLC, including any modifications or changes.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N015304-051924
Freedom of Information Act Request: DDoSecrets (Defense Intelligence Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, describing or relating to Distributed Denial of Secrets, abbreviated DDoSecrets. 

DDoSecrets is a non-profit whistleblower site founded in 2018 for news leaks which is sometimes referred to as a successor to WikiLeaks and came to international attention for its June 2020 publication of police documents, known as BlueLeaks. 

You may limit the search to between December 2018 and the date the search is performed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma North-Best

communications.subject: Acknowledgment Letter re FOIA Request No. 2024-USMS-000491
communications.communication:
Good Day, We hope this email finds you safe and in g ood health.  Please find a ttached an acknowledgement letter pertaining to USMS FOIARequest Number 2024-USMS-000491. Should you have any questions, please contact the United States Marshals Service through the Public Access Link (PAL). or via the following address: (http://https://foia.usmarshals.gov/) United States Marshals Service, Office of General Counsel FOIA Unit, CG-3, 15th Floor, Washington, DC 20530-001. Thank you, USMS FOIA Administrative Team 
The United States Marshals Service would likeyour opinion on the processing of this request. The survey is optional and willbe used in furtherance of improving upon the FOIA requesting process. Allresponses will be reviewed by an independent component of the USMS and not bythe FOIA Office itself; accordingly, any responses received will not affect theprocessing of your request: https://usms.gov1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_1ADObMYFw7DI3Y2 (https://usms.gov1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_1ADObMYFw7DI3Y2)
